alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 09 at 7:40AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: The Mount Shasta Avalanche Center in Shasta has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas: NWS Medford OR - CAZ082 (South Central Siskiyou County) * WHAT...The Forest Service Mount Shasta Avalanche Center has issued an avalanche warning for Mount Shasta area backcountry of Northern California. * WHERE...Avalanche terrain of Mount Shasta, Castle Lake, the Eddy Mountains and Ash Creek Butte area east of Mount Shasta. * WHEN...In effect from Thu 07:00 PST to Fri 16:00 PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy wind, rain, flooding, and heavy high-elevation snow is expected for the area as an atmospheric river impacts the region over the next 24 hours. Large avalanches could occur in a variety of areas in the mountains of Siskiyou County. Nearly three inches of water is forecast, with snow accumulation of 33 to 47 inches of snow for a 24-hour period. Feet of wet, heavy new snow will fall on lighter, low density snow. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in, near, or below avalanche terrain is not recommended. Recreational users without backcountry avalanche skills are advised to stay out of the backcountry. Deep snow conditions exist. Consult http://shastaavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
